title: Rave horticulture: the hotel garden on Ibiza that feeds the party people
text:
Reaching to pick a perfect fig as the sun set over quiet orange groves, I found it hard to believe I was in Ibiza, party capital of Europe. Harder still to believe that I’d just scrumped from the glamorous Atzaró hotel spa – home to celebs, fashionistas and de-toxing revellers. Yet the wandering hands of veg lovers may soon be a concern for the hotel, with the launch of its new eight-acre organic plot.

In the heart of the island’s northern farmlands, Atzaró is a family-run business based around a 300-year-old farmhouse. Local roads are lined with wild fennel, while gardens brim with zinnias, figs and olives. Suites are surrounded by swimming pools, palm trees, fruiting opuntia, grape vines, pomegranates...
